00017 from abc import ABCMeta as _ABCMeta
00018 from abc import abstractmethod as _abstractmethod
00019 from lsm import LsmError, ErrorNumber
00020 
00021 
00022 class IPlugin(object):
00023     """
00024     Plug-in interface that all plug-ins must implement for basic
00025     operation.
00026     """
00027     __metaclass__ = _ABCMeta
00028 
00029     @_abstractmethod
00030     def plugin_register(self, uri, password, timeout, flags=0):
00031         """
00032         Method first called to setup the plug-in (except for plugin_info)
00033 
00034         This would be the place to make a connection to the array.
00035 
00036         Returns None on success, else LsmError exception
00037         """
00038         pass
00039 
00040     @_abstractmethod
00041     def time_out_set(self, ms, flags=0):
00042         """
00043         Sets any time-outs for the plug-in (ms)
00044 
00045         Returns None on success, else LsmError exception
00046         """
00047         pass
00048 
00049     @_abstractmethod
00050     def time_out_get(self, flags=0):
00051         """
00052         Retrieves the current time-out
00053 
00054         Returns time-out in ms, else raise LsmError
00055         """
00056         pass
00057 
00058     @_abstractmethod
00059     def plugin_unregister(self, flags=0):
00060         """
00061         Called when the client wants to finish up or the socket goes eof.
00062         Plug-in should clean up all resources.  Note: In the case where
00063         the socket goes EOF and the plugin_unregister runs into errors the
00064         exception(s) will not be delivered to the client!
00065 
00066         Returns None on success, else LsmError exception
00067         """
00068         pass
00069 
00070     @_abstractmethod
00071     def job_status(self, job_id, flags=0):
00072         """
00073         Returns the stats of the given job.
00074 
00075         Returns a tuple ( status (enumeration), percent_complete,
00076                             completed item).
00077         else LsmError exception.
00078         """
00079         pass
00080 
00081     @_abstractmethod
00082     def job_free(self, job_id, flags=0):
00083         """
00084         Frees resources for a given job.
00085 
00086         Returns None on success, else raises an LsmError
00087         """
00088         pass
00089 
00090     @_abstractmethod
00091     def capabilities(self, system, flags=0):
00092         """
00093         Returns the capabilities for the selected system, raises LsmError
00094         """
00095         pass
00096 
00097     @_abstractmethod
00098     def plugin_info(self, flags=0):
00099         """
00100         Returns the description and version for plug-in, raises LsmError
00101 
00102         Note: Make sure plugin can handle this call before plugin_register is
00103         called.
00104         """
00105         pass
00106 
00107     @_abstractmethod
00108     def pools(self, search_key=None, search_value=None, flags=0):
00109         """
00110         Returns an array of pool objects.  Pools are used in both block and
00111         file system interfaces, thus the reason they are in the base class.
00112 
00113         Raises LsmError on error
00114         """
00115         pass
00116 
00117     @_abstractmethod
00118     def systems(self, flags=0):
00119         """
00120         Returns an array of system objects.  System information is used to
00121         distinguish resources from on storage array to another when the plug=in
00122         supports the ability to have more than one array managed by it
00123 
00124         Raises LsmError on error
00125         """
00126         pass
00127

00131     def volumes(self, search_key=None, search_value=None, flags=0):
00132         """
00133         Returns an array of volume objects
00134 
00135         Raises LsmError on error
00136         """
00137         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00138 
00139     def volume_create(self, pool, volume_name, size_bytes, provisioning,
00140                       flags=0):
00141         """
00142         Creates a volume, given a pool, volume name, size and provisioning
00143 
00144         Returns a tuple (job_id, new volume)
00145         Note: Tuple return values are mutually exclusive, when one
00146         is None the other must be valid.
00147         """
00148         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00149 
00150     def volume_delete(self, volume, flags=0):
00151         """
00152         Deletes a volume.
00153 
00154         Returns Job id or None if completed, else raises LsmError on errors.
00155         """
00156         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00157 
00158     def volume_resize(self, volume, new_size_bytes, flags=0):
00159         """
00160         Re-sizes a volume.
00161 
00162         Returns a tuple (job_id, re-sized_volume)
00163         Note: Tuple return values are mutually exclusive, when one
00164         is None the other must be valid.
00165         """
00166         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00167 
00168     def volume_replicate(self, pool, rep_type, volume_src, name, flags=0):
00169         """
00170         Replicates a volume from the specified pool.  In this library, to
00171         replicate means to create a new volume which is a copy of the source.
00172 
00173         Returns a tuple (job_id, replicated volume)
00174         Note: Tuple return values are mutually exclusive, when one
00175         is None the other must be valid.
00176         """
00177         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00178 
00179     def volume_replicate_range_block_size(self, system, flags=0):
00180         """
00181         Returns the number of bytes per block for volume_replicate_range
00182         call.  Callers of volume_replicate_range need to use this when
00183         calculating start and block lengths.
00184 
00185         Note: bytes per block may not match volume blocksize.
00186 
00187         Returns bytes per block, Raises LsmError on error
00188         """
00189         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00190 
00191     def volume_replicate_range(self, rep_type, volume_src, volume_dest, ranges,
00192                                flags=0):
00193         """
00194         Replicates a portion of a volume to itself or another volume.  The src,
00195         dest and number of blocks values change with vendor, call
00196         volume_replicate_range_block_size to get block unit size.
00197 
00198         Returns Job id or None if completed, else raises LsmError on errors.
00199         """
00200         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00201 
00202     def volume_enable(self, volume, flags=0):
00203         """
00204         Makes a volume available to the host
00205 
00206         Returns None on success, else raises LsmError on errors.
00207         """
00208         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00209 
00210     def volume_disable(self, volume, flags=0):
00211         """
00212         Makes a volume unavailable to the host

00214         Returns None on success, else raises LsmError on errors.
00215         """
00216         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00217 
00218     def iscsi_chap_auth(self, init_id, in_user, in_password, out_user,
00219                         out_password, flags):
00220         """
00221         Register a user/password for the specified initiator for CHAP
00222         authentication.  in_user & in_password are for inbound CHAP, out_user &
00223         out_password are for outbound CHAP.
00224 
00225         Note: Setting in_user, in_password or out_user, out_password to None
00226         will disable authentication.
00227 
00228         Raises LsmError on error
00229         """
00230         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00231

00234         Allows an access group to access a volume.

00236         Returns None on success, else raises LsmError on errors.

00238         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")

00241         """
00242         Revokes access for an access group for a volume

00244         Returns None on success, else raises LsmError on errors.
00245         """
00246         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")

00295     def volume_child_dependency(self, volume, flags=0):
00296         """
00297         Returns True if this volume has other volumes which are dependant on
00298         it.  Implies that this volume cannot be deleted or possibly modified
00299         because it would affect its children.
00300         """
00301         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00302 
00303     def volume_child_dependency_rm(self, volume, flags=0):
00304         """
00305         If this volume has child dependency, this method call will fully
00306         replicate the blocks removing the relationship between them.  This
00307         should return None (success) if volume_child_dependency would return
00308         False.
00309 
00310         Note:  This operation could take a very long time depending on the size
00311         of the volume and the number of child dependencies.
00312 
00313         Returns None if complete else job id, raises LsmError on errors.
00314         """
00315         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00316 
00317     def target_ports(self, search_key=None, search_value=None, flags=0):
00318         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")

00321 class INetworkAttachedStorage(IPlugin):
00322     """
00323     Class the represents Network attached storage (Common NFS/CIFS operations)
00324     """
00325     def fs(self, search_key=None, search_value=None, flags=0):
00326         """
00327         Returns a list of file systems on the controller. Raises LsmError on
00328         errors.
00329         """
00330         pass
00331 
00332     def fs_delete(self, fs, flags=0):
00333         """
00334         WARNING: Destructive
00335 
00336         Deletes a file system and everything it contains
00337         Returns None on success, else job id
00338         """
00339         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00340 
00341     def fs_resize(self, fs, new_size_bytes, flags=0):
00342         """
00343         Re-size a file system
00344 
00345         Returns a tuple (job_id, re-sized file system)
00346         Note: Tuple return values are mutually exclusive, when one
00347         is None the other must be valid.
00348         """
00349         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00350 
00351     def fs_create(self, pool, name, size_bytes, flags=0):
00352         """
00353         Creates a file system given a pool, name and size.
00354         Note: size is limited to 2**64 bytes so max size of a single volume
00355         at this time is 16 Exabytes
00356 
00357         Returns a tuple (job_id, file system)
00358         Note: Tuple return values are mutually exclusive, when one
00359         is None the other must be valid.
00360         """
00361         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00362 
00363     def fs_clone(self, src_fs, dest_fs_name, snapshot=None, flags=0):
00364         """
00365         Creates a thin, point in time read/writable copy of src to dest.
00366         Optionally uses snapshot as backing of src_fs
00367 
00368         Returns a tuple (job_id, file system)
00369         Note: Tuple return values are mutually exclusive, when one
00370         is None the other must be valid.
00371         """
00372         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00373 
00374     def fs_file_clone(self, fs, src_file_name, dest_file_name, snapshot=None,
00375                       flags=0):
00376         """
00377         Creates a thinly provisioned clone of src to dest.
00378         Note: Source and Destination are required to be on same filesystem
00379 
00380         Returns Job id or None if completed, else raises LsmError on errors.
00381         """
00382         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00383 
00384     def fs_snapshots(self, fs, flags=0):
00385         """
00386         Returns a list of snapshots for the supplied file system,
00387         Raises LsmError on error
00388         """
00389         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00390 
00391     def fs_snapshot_create(self, fs, snapshot_name, flags=0):
00392         """
00393         Snapshot is a point in time read-only copy
00394 
00395         Create a snapshot on the chosen file system
00396 
00397         Returns a tuple (job_id, snap shot created)
00398         Note: Tuple return values are mutually exclusive, when one
00399         is None the other must be valid.
00400 
00401         Note:  Snapshot name may not match
00402         what was passed in (depends on array implementation)
00403         """
00404         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00405 
00406     def fs_snapshot_delete(self, fs, snapshot, flags=0):
00407         """
00408         Frees the re-sources for the given snapshot on the supplied filesystem.
00409 
00410         Returns Job id or None if completed, else raises LsmError on errors.
00411         """
00412         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00413 
00414     def fs_snapshot_restore(self, fs, snapshot, files, restore_files,
00415                             all_files=False, flags=0):
00416         """
00417         WARNING: Destructive!
00418 
00419         Reverts a file-system or just the specified files from the snapshot.
00420         If a list of files is supplied but the array cannot restore just them
00421         then the operation will fail with an LsmError raised.
00422         If files == None and all_files = True then all files on the
00423         file-system are restored.
00424 
00425         Restore_file if not None must be the same length as files with each
00426         index in each list referring to the associated file.
00427 
00428         Returns None on success, else job id, LsmError exception on error
00429         """
00430         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00431 
00432     def fs_child_dependency(self, fs, files, flags=0):
00433         """
00434         Returns True if the specified filesystem or specified file on this
00435         file system has child dependencies.  This implies that this filesystem
00436         or specified file on this file system cannot be deleted or possibly
00437         modified because it would affect its children.
00438         """
00439         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00440 
00441     def fs_child_dependency_rm(self, fs, files, flags=0):
00442         """
00443         If this filesystem or specified file on this filesystem has child
00444         dependency this method will fully replicate the blocks removing the
00445         relationship between them.  This should return None(success) if
00446         fs_child_dependency would return False.
00447 
00448         Note:  This operation could take a very long time depending on the size
00449         of the filesystem and the number of child dependencies.
00450 
00451         Returns Job id or None if completed, else raises LsmError on errors.
00452         """
00453         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT, "Not supported")
00454
